intro: Moliniopsis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved grass, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. These plants are typically found in temperate regions and thrive in moist, well-drained soils. Moliniopsis species are often used in ecological restoration projects due to their ability to stabilize soil and support biodiversity. Their growth habits make them valuable in both natural and cultivated landscapes.
